ground_truth: He listens and plays the recordings again, but decides they are no good and returns to his carpet sweeping. The camera pans farther left to the salesman's apartment where there are no lights burning behind the drawn shade of the bedroom, but the living room and the kitchen are lighted. The camera continues its pan to the left, including the couple who sleep on the fire escape in the hot weather; the man is in the act of laying out the mattress. His wife, slightly younger and a peroxided, faded showgirl type, is also wearing pajamas with a fluffy handkerchief in the left pocket. She leans over the railing holding onto the rope which leads to the dog's basket now on the floor of the courtyard. The couple, upon closer inspection, reveals the man is balding and middle-aged, and the woman, having been a one-time siffleuse, calls to the dog with a clarion and melodic tone. The man is wearing striped pajamas. The little dog emerges reluctantly from the shadows and steps into the basket, which begins to move upward as the camera follows it. When the basket reaches the fire escape, the camera pans on to the apartment of Miss Torso who is in the bathroom brushing her long hair, her thoughts seemingly far away. The camera drops down to the apartment below, occupied by the elderly lady with the hearing aid, who is hard at work on a piece of abstract sculpture. We see her activities inside the apartment for the first time as she wears a short smock, her legs still bare. Her sculpture takes the form of a piece of mahogany through which a simple hole has been carved. The camera moves on much farther to the left and eventually rests on the newly-weds' apartment with the shade still drawn. It moves on and at last passes through Jeff's window, coming to rest on the two big heads of Jeff and Lisa. Her lips brush lightly against his cheek as she speaks, sitting on his sound knee with her arms around his neck. She starts kissing him but then gives up trying to interest him in romance and moves back from the embrace. Lisa stands, straightens out her dress, stretches a little, then turns to the divan, apparently not too interested in Jeff's observation about the salesman's life. However, her expression is disturbed as she watches Jeff. We see that Jeff's apartment is in darkness, faintly lit from the distant light of the neighbors' window. Jeff is thoughtful for a moment, then relaxes and smiles a little as Lisa stretches herself out on the divan.

The man is wearing striped sleepwear. The little dog emerges unwillingly from the obscurity and steps into the basket, which begins to ascend as the camera tracks it. The camera descends to the dwelling below, inhabited by the elderly dame with the hearing need, who is hard at work on a piece of abstract art. We see her activities inside the apartment for the first time as she wears a short coat, her legs still uncovered. Her sculpture takes the form of a piece of hardwood through which a simple orifice has been carved. The camera progresses on much farther to the left and ultimately rests on the newlyweds' apartment with the curtain still drawn. test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: He listens and plays the recordings again, but they are decided to be no good by him and his carpet sweeping is returned to. Farther left, the camera pans to the salesman's apartment where no lights burn behind the drawn shade of the bedroom, but the living room and the kitchen light is on. To the left, the camera continues its pan, including the couple who sleep on the fire escape in the hot weather; the mattress is being laid out by the man. A peroxided, faded showgirl type, slightly younger, is his wife, who is also wearing pajamas with a fluffy handkerchief in the left pocket. Over the railing, she leans while holding onto the rope which leads to the dog's basket now on the floor of the courtyard. Upon closer inspection, the man is revealed by the couple to be balding and middle-aged, and a clarion and melodic tone is used by the woman, having been a one-time siffleuse, to call to the dog. Striped pajamas are worn by the man. The little dog reluctantly emerges from the shadows and steps into the basket, which is begun to be moved upward as the camera follows it. As the basket reaches the fire escape, the camera pans on to the apartment of Miss Torso who is brushing her long hair in the bathroom, her thoughts seemingly far away. The camera drops down to the apartment below, occupied by the elderly lady with the hearing aid, who works hard on a piece of abstract sculpture. Her activities inside the apartment are seen for the first time as a short smock is worn by her, her legs still bare. The form of a piece of mahogany through which a simple hole has been carved is taken by her sculpture. Much farther to the left, the camera moves on and eventually rests on the newly-weds' apartment with the shade still drawn. It moves on and at last passes through Jeff's window, coming to rest on the two big heads of Jeff and Lisa. His cheek is brushed lightly by her lips as she speaks, sitting on his sound knee with her arms around his neck. He is started to be kissed by her but trying to interest him in romance is given up by her, and she moves back from the embrace. Lisa stands, her dress is straightened out by her, she stretches a little, then turns to the divan, apparently not too interested in the observation by Jeff about the salesman's life. However, she watches Jeff with a disturbed expression. It is seen that darkness is in Jeff's apartment, faintly lit from the distant light of the neighbors' window. Jeff is thoughtful for a moment, then a little smile comes from him as Lisa stretches herself out on the divan.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He replays the recordings but finds them unsatisfactory and resumes sweeping. The camera pans left to the salesman's apartment where the bedroom is dark, but the living room and kitchen are lit. It continues left to a couple sleeping on the fire escape; the man lays out a mattress. His wife, a peroxide-blonde, faded showgirl, wears pajamas with a fluffy handkerchief. She leans over the railing, holding the rope for the dog's basket. The man is balding and middle-aged; the woman, once a siffleuse, calls to the dog melodically. The striped pajama-clad man watches as the reluctant dog steps into the basket, which ascends as the camera follows. The camera pans to Miss Torso in the bathroom, brushing her long hair, seemingly lost in thought. It drops to the elderly lady's apartment beneath, where she works on abstract sculpture, wearing a short smock. Her sculpture is mahogany with a simple hole. The camera moves left to the newlyweds' apartment with its shade drawn, then through Jeff's window, resting on Jeff and Lisa. Lisa kisses Jeff's cheek, sits on his sound knee, attempts romance, but pulls back. She stands, straightens her dress, stretches, and turns to the divan, seemingly uninterested in Jeff's comments on the salesman. Her expression is disturbed as she watches Jeff, whose dark apartment is faintly lit by neighbors' lights. Jeff is thoughtful, then relaxes and smiles slightly as Lisa stretches on the divan.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He replays the recordings, finds them lacking, and resumes sweeping. The camera pans to the salesman's dim apartment, where only the living room and kitchen are lit. Continuing left, we see a couple on the fire escape; the man lays a mattress, while his wife, a faded showgirl, holds a rope for their dog's basket. The middle-aged, balding man wears striped pajamas, and his wife calls melodically to the dog, which reluctantly enters the basket and rises. The camera moves to Miss Torso brushing her hair, then to the elderly lady with a hearing aid working on an abstract mahogany sculpture. The camera pans further to the newlyweds' shaded apartment and finally rests on Jeff and Lisa. Lisa's lips brush Jeff's cheek, but she loses interest in romance, stands, adjusts her dress, and watches Jeff with a disturbed expression. Jeff’s apartment is dimly lit by neighbors’ light. He thinks, relaxes, and smiles as Lisa stretches on the divan.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He carefully listens to the recordings, playing them back multiple times, but ultimately concludes that they are not satisfactory. Disappointed, he decides to return to his task of sweeping the carpet. The camera then moves further to the left, transitioning smoothly to capture the scene inside the salesman's apartment. In this apartment, there are no lights shining from within the bedroom, where the shade is fully drawn, ensuring complete darkness. However, the living room and kitchen are illuminated, casting a warm glow. The camera continues its leftward journey, eventually revealing a couple who have chosen to sleep on the fire escape to escape the stifling heat. The man is in the midst of preparing the mattress for the night. His wife, a little younger and resembling a worn-out showgirl with her peroxide-blonde hair, is also clad in pajamas. Her attire includes a fluffy handkerchief tucked into the left pocket. She leans delicately over the railing, gripping a rope that leads to the dog’s basket, which rests on the courtyard floor. Closer observation of the couple reveals that the man is balding and middle-aged, while the woman, who was once a siffleuse, now calls to the dog with a clear and melodious voice. The man, comfortably dressed in striped pajamas, continues his task. The small dog hesitantly emerges from the shadows and steps gingerly into the basket, which is hoisted upward, and the camera follows its ascent. When the basket reaches the fire escape, the camera gradually pans to focus on Miss Torso’s apartment. She is in the bathroom, attentively brushing her long, flowing hair, her thoughts seemingly wandering far away. The camera then shifts downward to the apartment directly below, inhabited by an elderly lady using a hearing aid. She is deeply engrossed in her artistic pursuit, working diligently on a piece of abstract sculpture. This is the first time we witness her activities inside her apartment. She is wearing a short smock, and her legs remain bare as she works. The sculpture she is crafting takes the shape of a piece of mahogany, through which she has carved a simple hole. The camera continues to move further to the left, eventually arriving at the newlyweds' apartment, where the shade remains drawn. As the camera pans on, it finally passes through Jeff's window, settling on the two prominent heads of Jeff and Lisa. Her lips gently brush against his cheek as she speaks softly, sitting on his uninjured knee with her arms affectionately wrapped around his neck. She begins to kiss him but then relinquishes her attempts to engage him in romance, withdrawing from the embrace. Lisa rises, smooths out her dress, stretches lightly, and turns towards the divan, evidently showing little interest in Jeff’s comments about the salesman’s life. However, her expression is troubled as she continues to observe Jeff. Within Jeff's apartment, darkness prevails, faintly illuminated by the distant glow of the neighbors’ window. Jeff appears contemplative for a brief moment, then relaxes and smiles faintly as Lisa stretches herself comfortably on the divan.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With meticulous care and great attention to detail, he listens to the recordings, playing them back repeatedly, perhaps several times, but ultimately reaches the conclusion that they do not meet his standards and are not satisfactory. Feeling a sense of disappointment, he decides to return to his previous task of methodically sweeping the carpet. The camera then smoothly shifts further to the left, transitioning seamlessly to capture the interior scene inside the salesman's apartment. In this quiet apartment, there are no lights shining within the confines of the bedroom, as the shade is completely drawn down, ensuring that the room is enveloped in complete darkness. However, the adjoining living room and kitchen areas are brightly illuminated, casting a warm and inviting glow throughout the space. The camera continues its leftward journey, eventually revealing a couple who have opted to sleep on the fire escape in an attempt to escape the oppressive and stifling heat. The man busies himself with preparations, carefully arranging the mattress for the night. His wife, younger in appearance and bearing a resemblance to a worn-out showgirl with her peroxide-blonde hair, is also dressed comfortably in pajamas. Her attire is complemented by a fluffy handkerchief tucked neatly into the left pocket. She leans delicately over the railing, gently gripping a rope that extends all the way down to the dog’s basket, which rests securely on the courtyard floor below. A closer observation of the couple reveals the man to be balding and quite middle-aged, while the woman, who once entertained as a siffleuse, now calls out to the dog with a clear, melodious voice. The man, wearing striped pajamas that fit comfortably, continues his task with efficiency. The small dog, with some hesitation, emerges from the shadows, gingerly stepping into the basket, which is hoisted upward, and the camera attentively follows its ascent. When the basket reaches the fire escape, the camera gradually pans to focus in on Miss Torso’s apartment. There, in the bathroom, she is seen attentively brushing her long, flowing hair, seemingly lost in thought, her mind wandering far away. The camera then shifts its focus downward to the apartment directly below, where an elderly lady, who relies on a hearing aid, is deeply engrossed in her artistic pursuits, working diligently on a piece of abstract sculpture. This moment marks the first time we, as the audience, witness her creative activities inside her apartment. She is wearing a short smock, leaving her legs bare as she works. The sculpture she is crafting takes on the shape of a piece of mahogany wood, through which she has meticulously carved a simple hole. The camera persists in its leftward motion, eventually arriving at the newlyweds' apartment, where, notably, the shade remains drawn, adding an air of mystery. As the camera continues to pan on, it finally transitions through Jeff's window, settling on the two prominent heads of Jeff and Lisa. Her lips gently brush against his cheek as she speaks softly, sitting comfortably on his uninjured knee, with her arms lovingly wrapped around his neck. She begins to kiss him but then, choosing to relinquish her attempts to engage him in romance, withdraws from the embrace. Lisa rises gracefully, smooths out her dress, stretches lightly, and turns towards the divan, evidently showing little interest in Jeff’s comments about the salesman’s life. However, her expression is troubled as she continues to closely observe Jeff. Within the confines of Jeff's apartment, darkness prevails, with only a faint illumination provided by the distant glow from the neighbors’ window. Jeff appears deep in contemplation for a brief, fleeting moment, before gradually relaxing and smiling faintly as Lisa stretches herself comfortably on the divan.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He listens intently to the recordings, replaying them to scrutinize the sounds captured, but a growing dissatisfaction prompts him to conclude that they are inadequate. Accepting this, he sets the recordings aside and returns to his task of carpet sweeping. The camera then begins a smooth pan to the left, transitioning gracefully to the salesman's apartment where an absence of light behind the drawn bedroom shade suggests he's not home, yet the vivid illumination in the living room and kitchen hints at a recent presence or a deliberate choice of lighting. As the camera continues its careful leftward glide, it captures the image of a couple seeking relief from the oppressive heat by sleeping on the fire escape; the man is in the midst of methodically laying out the mattress to ensure comfort. His wife, who appears younger and carries the faded allure of a once glamorous showgirl, is dressed in pajamas adorned with a fluffy handkerchief tucked neatly into the left pocket. She leans over the fire escape railing, securely holding onto the rope attached to their dog's basket, which now rests on the courtyard floor below. Examining the couple more closely, the man is revealed to be balding and middle-aged, while the woman, a former siffleuse, summons the dog with her melodically clarion call. Clad in striped pajamas, the man complements the scene. The little dog hesitates, emerging reluctantly from the shadowed corners, and steps into its basket, which begins to ascend as the camera smoothly tracks its upward journey. Upon the basket reaching the fire escape, the camera shifts focus, continuing its leftward pan to the apartment of Miss Torso, who is engaged in the rhythmic act of brushing her long hair in the bathroom, seemingly lost in distant thoughts. The camera's gaze then descends to the apartment directly below, inhabited by an elderly lady sporting a hearing aid, who is deeply absorbed in crafting a piece of abstract sculpture. For the first time, her activities unfold before us; she dons a short smock, legs left bare, as she meticulously carves into a piece of mahogany, creating a simple yet profound hole. The camera then journeys further left, finally coming to pause at the apartment of the newlyweds, discreetly veiled by drawn shades. Moving beyond, the camera eventually traverses through Jeff's window, settling on the scene of Jeff and Lisa, whose two large heads dominate the frame. Lisa's lips barely graze Jeff's cheek as she speaks, nestled on his sound knee with her arms draped affectionately around his neck. She initiates a kiss, an attempt to ignite romantic interest, but soon relinquishes, retreating slightly from their embrace. Standing up, Lisa smooths her dress, stretches languidly, and turns towards the divan, seemingly unmoved by Jeff’s commentary on the salesman’s life. Nonetheless, her expression betrays a hint of disturbance as she observes Jeff. The dim setting of Jeff’s apartment, illuminated faintly by the distant glow from the neighboring windows, frames this moment. Jeff, pensive, takes a moment before a relaxed smile breaks through as Lisa gracefully stretches out on the divan.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: He listens to the recordings again but deems them unsatisfactory and resumes sweeping the carpet. The camera pans left to the salesman's apartment, showing the living room and kitchen illuminated while the bedroom remains dark. It continues to pan, capturing a couple on the fire escape in the warm weather; the man is laying out a mattress and the woman, resembling a faded showgirl, tends to the dog in the courtyard. The man, middle-aged and balding, wears striped pajamas, while his wife calls to the dog with a melodious tone. The reluctant dog steps into the basket which ascends to the fire escape as the camera follows. It then pans to Miss Torso, brushing her hair in the bathroom, lost in thought. The camera drops to the elderly lady's apartment below, where she works on an abstract sculpture, wearing a smock with bare legs. Her artwork is a piece of mahogany with a carved hole. The camera moves further left to the newlyweds' apartment with the shade drawn, eventually passing through Jeff's window. It focuses on Jeff and Lisa, as she lightly kisses his cheek and sits on his sound knee. Lisa attempts to engage him in romance, but eventually gives up, distracted by his comments about the salesman. She stands, adjusts her dress, stretches, and turns to the divan, her expression disturbed as she watches Jeff. The dimly lit room from neighbors' windows presents Jeff as thoughtful for a moment, before he relaxes and smiles as Lisa stretches out on the divan.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He listens and plays the recordings again, but decides they are no good and returns to his carpet sweeping, a task he often uses to clear his mind, a habit formed during his years working in the hospitality industry. The camera pans farther left to the salesman's apartment where there are no lights burning behind the drawn shade of the bedroom, but the living room and the kitchen are lighted, suggesting he either works late nights or prefers this lighting for relaxation. The camera continues its pan to the left, including the couple who sleep on the fire escape in the hot weather, a common practice in cities like New York where air conditioning was once a luxury; the man is in the act of laying out the mattress. His wife, slightly younger and a peroxided, faded showgirl type who once performed in mid-tier city theatres, is also wearing pajamas with a fluffy handkerchief in the left pocket, a fashion accessory popular in the 1950s. She leans over the railing holding onto the rope which leads to the dog's basket now on the floor of the courtyard. The couple, upon closer inspection, reveals the man is balding and middle-aged, and the woman, having been a one-time siffleuse, an onstage whistler who added charm to musical acts, calls to the dog with a clarion and melodic tone. The man is wearing striped pajamas reminiscent of those sold in department stores during the era. The little dog emerges reluctantly from the shadows and steps into the basket, which begins to move upward as the camera follows it. When the basket reaches the fire escape, the camera pans on to the apartment of Miss Torso who is in the bathroom brushing her long hair, her thoughts seemingly far away, perhaps dreaming of her aspirations to become a professional dancer. The camera drops down to the apartment below, occupied by the elderly lady with the hearing aid, who is hard at work on a piece of abstract sculpture, a craft she took up after retiring from teaching art. We see her activities inside the apartment for the first time as she wears a short smock, her legs still bare, a practical outfit for working with materials. Her sculpture takes the form of a piece of mahogany through which a simple hole has been carved, reflecting the minimalist art movement she admires. The camera moves on much farther to the left and eventually rests on the newly-weds' apartment with the shade still drawn, indicating their desire for privacy as they settle into married life. It moves on and at last passes through Jeff's window, coming to rest on the two big heads of Jeff and Lisa. Her lips brush lightly against his cheek as she speaks, sitting on his sound knee with her arms around his neck, displaying the tenderness of their complicated relationship. She starts kissing him but then gives up trying to interest him in romance and moves back from the embrace. Lisa stands, straightens out her dress, stretches a little, then turns to the divan, apparently not too interested in Jeff's observation about the salesman's life from his perspective as a photojournalist. However, her expression is disturbed as she watches Jeff, reflecting her growing concern for his obsession. We see that Jeff's apartment is in darkness, faintly lit from the distant light of the neighbors' window, a symbolic indication of his isolation and detachment. Jeff is thoughtful for a moment, then relaxes and smiles a little as Lisa stretches herself out on the divan, suggesting a momentary peace in their ongoing tension.

She leans over the railing holding onto the rope which leads to the dog's basket now on the floor of the courtyard. She starts kissing him but then gives up trying to interest him in romance and moves back from the embrace. Lisa stands straightens out her dress stretches a little then turns to the divan apparently not too interested in Jeff's observation about the salesman's life. However her expression is disturbed as she watches Jeff. We see that Jeff's apartment is in darkness faintly lit from the distant light of the neighbors' window. Jeff is thoughtful for a moment then relaxes and smiles a little as Lisa stretches herself out on the divan.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: He listens and plays the recordings again but decides they are no good and returns to his carpet sweeping. The camera pans farther left to the salesman's apartment where there are no lights burning behind the drawn shade of the bedroom but the living room and the kitchen are lighted. The camera continues its pan to the left including the couple who sleep on the fire escape in the hot weather. We see that Jeff's apartment is in darkness faintly lit from the distant light of the neighbors' window. Jeff is thoughtful for a moment then relaxes and smiles a little as Lisa stretches herself out on the divan.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He scrutinizes and constructs the sculptures anew, yet concludes they are worthless and shifts to his cake decorating. The drone zooms farther right to the gardener's office where there are no fans spinning behind the closed curtain of the studio, but the gallery and the pantry are illuminated. The drone continues its zoom to the right, featuring the siblings who lounge on the trampoline in the frigid climate; the woman is in the act of spreading out the quilt. Her brother, slightly older and a bespectacled, faded philosopher type, is also dressed in overalls with a patched kerchief in the right pocket. He leans over the barricade gripping onto the cord which trails to the cat's cradle now on the tile of the courtyard. The siblings, upon closer scrutiny, show the woman is graying and senior, and the man, having been a former dramatist, calls to the cat with a harmonious and lyrical note. The woman is wearing polka-dotted overalls. The tiny cat emerges hesitantly from the mist and steps into the cradle, which starts to glide downward as the drone follows it. When the cradle reaches the trampoline, the drone zooms on to the office of Mr. Top Hat who is in the corridor polishing his shiny shoes, his worries seemingly distant. The drone descends to the studio beneath, inhabited by the youthful lad with the telescope, who is deeply engaged on a piece of surreal painting. We see his endeavors inside the studio for the first time as he wears a long apron, his arms still exposed. His painting takes the form of a piece of marble through which a complex groove has been etched. The drone shifts on much farther to the right and eventually settles on the newly-divorced couple's office with the curtain still lifted. It shifts on and at last slides through Rick's doorway, coming to settle on the two tiny hands of Rick and Laura. Her fingers glide gently against his wrist as she whispers, perched on his weary elbow with her hands around his necktie. She begins caressing him but then abandons attempting to captivate him in storytelling and shifts back from the cuddle. Laura rises, smooths out her skirt, flexes a little, then turns to the armchair, apparently not too captivated by Rick's insight about the gardener's routine. However, her demeanor is unsettled as she observes Rick. We see that Rick's office is in silence, faintly brightened from the close glow of the neighbors' room. Rick is contemplative for a moment, then loosens and grins a bit as Laura flexes herself out on the armchair.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: He replays the recordings, finds them unsatisfactory, and resumes sweeping. The camera shifts to the salesman's dim bedroom, contrasting with his lit living room and kitchen. It moves past a couple on the fire escape, preparing to sleep with their dog. The wife, a faded showgirl type, calls to the dog melodiously, while the husband in striped pajamas sets the mattress. The camera ascends to Miss Torso brushing her hair, seemingly lost in thought. Below, an elderly lady, in a short smock, works on an abstract mahogany sculpture. Continuing left, we glimpse the newlyweds' drawn shade before returning to Jeff’s window. Inside, Lisa lightly kisses Jeff, but he remains uninterested in romance. She adjusts her dress and lies on the divan, appearing disinterested in his observations about the salesman. Jeff is momentarily pensive in the dim light but smiles as Lisa stretches out on the divan.
